recount3 0.99.0

  • Changelog

Create a recount3 RangedSummarizedExperiment gene or exon object

Source: R/create_rse.R
create_rse.Rd

Once you have identified a project you want to work with, you can use this function to construct a recount3 RangedSummarizedExperiment-class (RSE) object at the gene or exon expression feature level. This function will retrieve the data, cache it, then assemble the RSE object.

create_rse(
  project_info,
  type = c("gene", "exon"),
  annotation = annotation_options(project_info$organism),
  bfc = BiocFileCache::BiocFileCache(),
  recount3_url = "http://snaptron.cs.jhu.edu/data/temp/recount3"
)

Arguments

project_info

A data.frame() with one row that contains the information for the project you are interested in. You can find which project to work on using todo().
type

A character(1) specifying whether you want to access gene counts or exon counts.
annotation

A character(1) specifying which annotation you want to download. Only used when type is either gene or exon.
bfc

A BiocFileCache-class object where the files will be cached to.
recount3_url

A character(1) specifying the home URL for recount3 or a local directory where you have mirrored recount3.

Value

A RangedSummarizedExperiment-class object.

Examples


## Find the project you are interested in
## (temporarily build this data.frame)
proj_info <- data.frame(
    project = "ERP001942",
    project_home = "data_sources/sra",
    organism = "human"
)

rse_gene_ERP001942 <- create_rse(proj_info)
#> using temporary cache /tmp/RtmpkEZEWK/BiocFileCache
#> adding rname 'http://snaptron.cs.jhu.edu/data/temp/recount3/human/data_sources'

#> ERR205000 Alias;;GEUV:NA20508|Broker name;;ArrayExpress|Description;;Protocols: For more information about the populations, ELSI, etc., see http://www.1000genomes.org/about#ProjectSamples and http://ccr.coriell.org/Default.aspx. EVB transformed lymphoblastoid cell lines (LCLs) from Coriell Cell Repositories (GBR, FIN, TSI) and University of Geneva (CEU, YRI) were shipped to ECACC (European COllection of Cell Cultures) as live cultures (06/2011 - 09/2011), in batches of ~ 30 samples from Coriell (GBR/FIN/TSI more or less randomized) and 2 x ~90 samples (by population) from Geneva. In ECACC, these cell lines were cultures to approximately 1.2 x 10e8 cells (06/2011-10/2011). These cultures were split to produce 8 x cell banks of the samples, and a snap frozen pellet of 2 x 10e7 cells from a proliferating culture. The cell pellets were shipped from ECACC to University of Geneva in three batches, the first batch consisting of CEU/GBR/FIN/TSI samples, and the second and third batch with YRI and some CEU samples. Total RNA was extracted from cell pellets using the TRIzol Reagent (Ambion). The pellets had been frozen at ECACC without any additives like RNAlater or Trizol. In Geneva they were thawed, 1mL of trizol was added in each sample, and the samples were transferred to eppendorf tubes. The rest of the protocol followed the manufacturer's guidelines. No DNAse treatment was done to the RNA samples. The RNA quality was assessed by Agilent Bioanalyzer RNA 6000 Nano Kit according to the manufacturer's instructions. The sample information includes a visual inspection of RNA quality (degradation), in the scale 0, 0.5, 1. RNA quantity was measured by Qubit 2.0 (Invitrogen) using the RNA Broad range kit according to the manufacturer's instructions.|INSDC center alias;;Geuvadis|INSDC center name;;Geuvadis|INSDC first public;;2012-11-06T17:02:05Z|INSDC last update;;2018-03-08T16:06:35Z|INSDC status;;public|population;;TSI|Sample Name;;ERS185362|SRA accession;;ERS185362|Strain;;lymphoblastoid cell line|Title;;NA20508
